title: Jeffree Star calls Michelle Dy's make-up brush line ‘trash’ in feud
text:
Jeffree Star hasn’t forgiven or forgotten his beef with Michelle Dy (Picture: Instagram/Getty)

Jeffree Star is no stranger to a feud or seven with fellow beauty YouTubers, and it looks like his beef with Michelle Dy isn’t going anywhere anytime soon…

After a fan asked Jeffree, 33, whether he could do a review of Michelle Dy’s brushes on his channel, the make-up artist scathingly replied: ‘I don’t have time to review trash on my channel!’

While Michelle didn’t reply to the tweet directly, she posted: ‘I’m good luv, enjoy’ an hour after his tweet.

It’s not the first time Jeffree has clapped back at Michelle, after he accused her of ripping off his series of videos where he tells fans which products he has ‘approved’ in summer 2018.

Jeffree, who has been making ‘Jeffree Star Approved’ videos since 2016, said on Snapchat: ‘So there is a Youtuber who is not known here in America, but they recently tried to steal my “approved” – trademarked – whole entire series and do it on their channel.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m like, I know I didn’t invent the word approved but girl, that’s been my thing for two years now. It’s trademarked, it’s on merch, don’t try me.

‘Sometimes I feel like people do that stuff on purpose, like “Let me use Jeffree’s thing and then he’ll cause a stir about it and I’ll get a lot more views and subscribers.”

‘I’m like b***h, I’m not even gonna mention your name. Don’t even bother searching for it after you hear this because we don’t wanna give no one any clout.

‘Thank god for lawyers. It’s all draining. Why can’t people just come up with their own f**king ideas.’

Michelle deleted her entire series of ‘approved’ videos, and issued an apology to Jeffree on social media, saying: ‘Jeffree Star is one of the few YouTube gurus I watch and look up to in the YouTube community.

‘Recently I uploaded 2 new videos in my youtube channel which was the “MD Approved New Series” inspired by Jeffree.’

She continued: ‘I was unaware that this “Jeffree Star Approved” series is copyrighted in America.

‘I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise to Jeffree Star if in any way or another, I may have violated your rights from the use of your trademark.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Videos from my channel has been deleted already and rest-assured that it will not happen again. Again, I am sorry.’

While it looked like that beef had been put to bed, it seems Jeffree is not one to forgive and forget that easily…

description: Jeffree Star has reignited his feud with Michelle Dy after calling her range of make-up brushes and sponges 'trash'.
